intro: Ivesia halophila, commonly known as saltbush, is a shrub native to arid and saline environments. It thrives in coastal and inland areas with high salinity, exhibiting adaptations to tolerate salt stress. The plant has small, narrow leaves that reduce water loss and salt accumulation. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters. Ivesia halophila plays a crucial role in stabilizing soils and supporting local wildlife in harsh environments.
